chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
L: Language

Goal:
forall A B : Formula, lt_depth B (impH A B)

Premises:
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N
lt_depth = fun A B : Formula => depth A < depth B : Formula -> Formula -> Prop
Inductive Formula : Set := equal : Term -> Term -> Formula | atomic : forall r : Relations L, Terms (arity L (inl r)) -> Formula | impH : Formula -> Formula -> Formula | notH : Formula -> Formula | forallH : nat -> Formula -> Formula Arguments forallH _%nat_scope
depthImp1 : forall A B : Formula, lt_depth A (impH A B)
iffH = fun A B : Formula => andH (impH A B) (impH B A) : Formula -> Formula -> Formula
ifThenElseH = fun A B C : Formula => andH (impH A B) (impH (notH A) C) : Formula -> Formula -> Formula -> Formula
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments snd {A B}%type_scope
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments fst {A B}%type_scope
prod_rec : forall (A B : Type) (P : A * B -> Set), (forall (a : A) (b : B), P (a, b)) -> forall p : A * B, P p
Inductive sum (A B : Type) : Type := inl : A -> A + B | inr : B -> A + B Arguments sum (_ _)%type_scope Arguments inl {A B}%type_scope, [A] _ _ Arguments inr {A B}%type_scope, _ [B] _
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B Arguments prod (_ _)%type_scope Arguments pair {A B}%type_scope
orH = fun A B : Formula => impH (notH A) B : Formula -> Formula -> Formula
andH = fun A B : Formula => notH (orH (notH A) (notH B)) : Formula -> Formula -> Formula
Inductive sumbool (A B : Prop) : Set := left : A -> {A} + {B} | right : B -> {A} + {B} Arguments sumbool (_ _)%type_scope Arguments left {A B}%type_scope, [A] _ _ Arguments right {A B}%type_scope, _ [B] _
Formula_ind : forall P : Formula -> Prop, (forall t t0 : Term, P (equal t t0)) -> (forall (r : Relations L) (t : Terms (arity L (inl r))), P (atomic r t)) -> (forall f1 : Formula, P f1 -> forall f2 : Formula, P f2 -> P (impH f1 f2)) -> (forall f2 : Formula, P f2 -> P (notH f2)) -> (forall (n : nat) (f3 : Formula), P f3 -> P (forallH n f3)) -> forall f4 : Formula, P f4
Formula_rec : forall P : Formula -> Set, (forall t t0 : Term, P (equal t t0)) -> (forall (r : Relations L) (t : Terms (arity L (inl r))), P (atomic r t)) -> (forall f1 : Formula, P f1 -> forall f2 : Formula, P f2 -> P (impH f1 f2)) -> (forall f2 : Formula, P f2 -> P (notH f2)) -> (forall (n : nat) (f3 : Formula), P f3 -> P (forallH n f3)) -> forall f4 : Formula, P f4
Formula_sind : forall P : Formula -> SProp, (forall t t0 : Term, P (equal t t0)) -> (forall (r : Relations L) (t : Terms (arity L (inl r))), P (atomic r t)) -> (forall f1 : Formula, P f1 -> forall f2 : Formula, P f2 -> P (impH f1 f2)) -> (forall f2 : Formula, P f2 -> P (notH f2)) -> (forall (n : nat) (f3 : Formula), P f3 -> P (forallH n f3)) -> forall f4 : Formula, P f4
Formula_rect : forall P : Formula -> Type, (forall t t0 : Term, P (equal t t0)) -> (forall (r : Relations L) (t : Terms (arity L (inl r))), P (atomic r t)) -> (forall f1 : Formula, P f1 -> forall f2 : Formula, P f2 -> P (impH f1 f2)) -> (forall f2 : Formula, P f2 -> P (notH f2)) -> (forall (n : nat) (f3 : Formula), P f3 -> P (forallH n f3)) -> forall f4 : Formula, P f4
depth = fix depth (A : Formula) : nat := match A with | impH A0 B => S (Nat.max (depth A0) (depth B)) | notH A0 | forallH _ A0 => S (depth A0) | _ => 0 end : Formula -> nat
app : forall A : Type, list A -> list A -> list A
BinNat.N.ls_ls' : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : BinNums.N, A z -> (forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt n z -> A (BinNat.N.succ n) -> A n) -> forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le n z -> (forall m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le m z -> BinNat.N.le (BinNat.N.succ n) m -> A m) -> A n
projT1 : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type), {x : A & P x} -> A
Setoid.Setoid_Theory : forall A : Type, Relation_Definitions.relation A -> Prop
Decidable.dec_not : forall A : Prop, Decidable.decidable A -> Decidable.decidable (~ A)
Relation_Operators.Lt_nil : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA nil (a :: x)
sigT_of_sigT2 : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Type), {x : A & P x & Q x} -> {x : A & P x}
Refl.make_conj : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop
Inductive Ltl (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> list A -> Prop := Lt_nil : forall (a : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA nil (a :: x) | Lt_hd : forall a b : A, leA a b ->...-> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y) Arguments Relation_Operators.Ltl _%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_hd _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_tl _%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
sumbool_rec : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Set), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
existT : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> {x : A & P x}
projT3 : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Type) (e : {x : A & P x & Q x}), Q (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 e))
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
